meanings.definition: (verb) to accumulate or increase over time
meanings.sent1: Money accrues in a piggy bank when you save a little every day.
meanings.sent2: Interest accrues on your savings account, helping your money grow.
meanings.sent3: The snowball of chores accrued until it was too big to ignore.
meanings.sent4: Kindness accrues like drops of rain, slowly but steadily making a difference.
meanings.sent5: Patience is a virtue that accrues wisdom and understanding over time.

meanings.definition: (verb) to be added as a benefit or advantage
meanings.sent1: Good health accrues from eating nutritious food and exercising regularly.
meanings.sent2: Experience accrues with each new challenge you face, making you stronger.
meanings.sent3: The joy of friendship accrued as they shared laughter and tears together.
meanings.sent4: Confidence accrues like a shield, protecting you from self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: Knowledge accrues like a treasure, enriching your mind and soul.

meanings.definition: (verb) to come into existence as a result of growth or increase
meanings.sent1: New opportunities accrue when you work hard and stay determined.
meanings.sent2: Success accrues from perseverance and a positive attitude.
meanings.sent3: Happiness accrued in the garden as flowers bloomed and bees buzzed.
meanings.sent4: Hope accrued in her heart like a sunrise after a long night.
meanings.sent5: Courage accrues when you face your fears and push beyond your limits.
